body.name: Cast Off: A Jesse McDermitt Novel (Caribbean Adventure Series Book 24)
body.description: After a terrible defeat in Key West, where the subject of Jesse McDermitt’s identity fraud investigation gets away, and which almost costs him dearly, Jesse returns home to his island in the Content Keys, determined to keep those he loves safe from harm.He makes plans to fly his family and friends to the Leeward Islands for a very special occasion, unaware of events taking place on one small uninhabited island located a short distance from his destination—events that will suck him right back into the fray, as a past nemesis rears their head.Gold will turn even the most docile into greedy, dangerous people. When the question of rightful ownership is brought up, legal professionals and government officials on the island, as well as those from France argue over a treasure estimated to be worth $20,000,000. But what is the price of one human life?The simple life isn’t what it’s cracked up to be, and danger abounds in the picturesque city of Gustavia, on the French island of St. Barts, and speeding Mini Mokes on steep mountain roads isn’t the cause.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Jesse is great and he does not know it, great influence and good read v for the adventure minded persons

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 11, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A great adventure
reviews.reviewText: Another Great Jesse McDermitt adventure as they never disappoint.I love how every story incorporates and old story and blends in with the new present day story !!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars A good read.
reviews.reviewText: This was a reasonable book. Unfortunately, I prefer his earlier work with a bit more adventure. I feel that writing in the first person may have gone to Wayne's head a little. In this book Jesse is a cross between James Bond and Superman.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars It is always nice when the whole gang is pulled into thae story
reviews.reviewText: The whole gang is back together. It was great how almost all the key characters from stories past and present were integrated into this story. It truly was a story well told. My only complaint was one I mention often. As Jesse often says, agood plan never survives the first encounter of a battle. However, in way to many stories in this series, the final battle works out perfectly as planned with no real harm to any of the good guys. That doesn't match reality and it always makes the ending feel a little artificial. The book was absolutely a five star read. However, the formulamatic ending to the final battle with the bad guys where the good guys come thru with no one suffering any harm or injury and the bad guys all got caught made the ending a bit of a let down. In the early days of this series, like in the real world, their was the joy of victory muted with the pain that comes from great harm to team of one or more good guys. I miss that bit of imposition of the real world being mixed in with the ultimate victory.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 30, 2023
reviews.reviewText: As always, Jesse McDermott novels, grab you and keep you fascinated all the way to the end. I’ve read everyone of them and wait with anticipation for the next one.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Full on adventures!
reviews.reviewText: I love reading about the adventures of this gang of guys! Mr Stinnett has a wondrous imagination! I know his books take a great deal of research, but he must spend so much of his time just fantasizing about what these guys (and gals) could get up to. I have truly enjoyed every single one of his books. You can start at the beginning of the series or you can start with the first one you find available to you and THEN go back to the first one and read them all in order- which is what I did. However you read them, just do it and you will have so many great adventures to take part in. This is what I recommend for you if you are the sort of person that likes oceans and islands and the adventures that happen there.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Not the same
reviews.reviewText: First off, I love Wayne Stinnett's books and Jesse McDermitt. This one was not his best. Kind of lame compared to other Jesse adventures. Charity makes an appearance and does not kill anyone. Are Jesse and Charity mellowing in their old age? Nah. They will come back with a vengeance. Looking forward to Fish On.Still a good read but I liked most of the previous books better.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The aging Jesse McDermitt
reviews.reviewText: As in the real world, Jesse is aging. Well he's still a tough guy he is come to understand that familia is what's really important. The love of a good woman once found is a treasure indeed. This story also includes a real treasure lost gold. The kind of gold that makes the heartbeat faster and greed rise to the surface especially of the bad guys. Alongside getting his daughter Flo married off, Jesse, rusty, deuce, charity, cheryl, and the rest of the crew must fend off crazy bad guys who only want the gold. Jesse and crew work hard to be successful. Will they get it done in time for Flo to get married? You'll have to read the book to find out.
a bit sad that Jess is getting older

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on November 6, 2022
reviews.reviewText: Jesse and Savanna are busy organising their daughter's wedding. The guests have been told they will need a passport to get to the wedding venue. Jesse and Buck Reilly are flying the guests to the Leeward Islands. Everything seems to be working out as arranged until after the Wedding Ceremony, which takes place on the beach, when Jesse notices an old adversary. The group become involved in a murder investigation during which Jesse is shot in the leg and Savanna kills his assailant. A very fast moving and exciting adventure, which is well worth reading.

reviews.reviewTitle: Cast Off, a book with guts and legs.
reviews.reviewText: I liked the overall story telling method of the author. Very clear word usage. No words just to build up the length or the word count.I like the author so I read his books.No gets five stars--is always room for improvement.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on November 28, 2022
reviews.reviewText: Good job it was free with Kindle unlimited or i would be wanting my money back! I get that Jessie is aging and slowing down but did we really want a blow by blow account of a wedding and the lead up to it, with a small amount of violence thrown in to appease us? This was a total waste of a Sunday afternoon. I will have to consider carefully continuing to read these.
